I would like to start with a story about scorpion and sage: A wise and peaceful sage sees a scorpion drowning in the river and decides to rescue it. He lifts the scorpion out of the water, but the scorpion stings him and he drops it back. The sage tries again, but the scorpion stings him once more. The sage does not give up and attempts to save the scorpion for the third time, but he gets stung again. He asks the scorpion why it keeps hurting him when he is trying to help. The scorpion replied, "I cannot help it. It is my nature to sting."

The moral of the story is that some creatures cannot change their nature and it is important to accept this fact and act accordingly.

This story applies to John Wick, a hitman who cannot escape his identity as an assassin. One character from the movie tells John that he is an assassin, and despite his efforts to get out of the business, he can't deny who he is. Even though John tries to avoid violence, he keeps getting pulled into it, and it's inevitable that he will continue to be a killer.

The movie is a classic genre movie: action. The action genre in movies is a type of film that typically features fast-paced and thrilling physical stunts, fights, and chases. In the end, you do not feel cheated.

One of the dialogues: "The bloodshed wasn't necessary. But the bloodshed was the point." It seems like the characters do not seek to achieve any goal or outcome by shedding blood, but rather they enjoy the act itself as an end in itself. They only care about satisfying their bloodlust and proving their dominance.

We often think that action is the best way to solve our problems and achieve our goals. But is that always true? What if our actions have negative consequences or go against our moral values? These questions challenge us to think more deeply about what it means to act and how our actions affect ourselves and others.

The movie has amazing and beautiful action scenes. The stunts are awesome, and, again, the gunfights look more like dance moves. Wick is always so smooth and clever when he fights.

The abundance of locations and vivid colors present a visual treat that is unmatched. The vivid imagery sets the perfect tone, both for the action and the dialogue. This movie offers an exceptional sensory journey, a rare treat not often found in action films. Every frame is dripping with texture and layers. There are so many things happening in the foreground and background, and yet you are never confused about what you have to focus on.

The story of John Wick, brought to life by the masterful acting of Keanu Reeves, is a tale of human suffering and redemption. Wick, once a man of simple desires, finds himself thrust into a world of violence and revenge, driven by his past traumas and the desire for retribution.

Reeves understands the depth of his character's suffering and portrays Wick not as a mere killing machine, but as a man with a soul that has been wounded by loss and grief. Despite the constant physical punishment he endures, Wick never loses sight of his humanity, and his pain only serves to reinforce his determination.

Through Wick's struggles, we see the timeless truth that suffering is an inherent part of the human experience.

One of the key tenets of stoicism is the idea that we should be indifferent to external circumstances. This does not mean that we should be unfeeling, but rather that we should strive to maintain a sense of inner calm. John Wick embodies this idea in many ways. Despite the numerous threats he faces, he remains calm and focused.

Another important principle is the idea that we should focus on what we can control, rather than worrying about what we cannot. John Wick exemplifies this idea in his single-minded pursuit of his goals. When someone threatens him, he does not waste time on fruitless worry or despair. Instead, he takes action to protect himself and those around him, using his skills and experience.

In short, John Wick is not just a deadly assassin, but also a stoic philosopher. Through his actions and demeanor, he embodies many of the key principles of stoicism.

John Wick 4 is action cinema turned into high art by creators who believe that every single one of the countless kills in this movie still has to look cool as hell. Overall, John Wick: Chapter 4 delivers exactly what you want from a John Wick film.

In its simplest form, the fourth installment of the John Wick series is an entertaining and action-packed movie, although some may argue it's overly action-packed.

However, let's get to the point. I purchased a ticket with the expectation of one thing, and that expectation was not only met but exceeded. From beginning to end, the movie kept me thoroughly entertained. It's worth mentioning the undeniable presence of over-the-top action sequences, where John Wick effortlessly becomes an invincible killing machine with impeccable aim and no concern for fall damage. If this were a game and we were playing as John Wick, it would undoubtedly be an exhilarating experience to annihilate enemies non-stop for two hours.

But let's not forget, this is precisely what I signed up for. I came to the movie anticipating a high-octane action extravaganza, and that's exactly what I got. Admittedly, the story took a backseat, but to be honest, I didn't expect a complex narrative in the first place.

What truly impressed me was the sheer creativity displayed in the cinematography. Each scene was meticulously crafted, showcasing top-tier action film production values that not only justified the budget but surpassed expectations.

In terms of concluding the series, John Wick Chapter 4 provides a satisfactory ending, although the story itself may not be compelling enough to explore further beyond the action presented to us.

However, I must emphasize that if you approach the film with conventional movie standards, expecting more than just action, you may find it lacking or even dull.

In summary, this movie is perfect for those seeking an adrenaline-fueled blockbuster solely focused on action. On the other hand, if you're looking for rich storytelling and well-developed characters, it's best to steer clear.

P. S: The character of John Wick was brilliantly established in the first movie, offering us glimpses into his backstory. The subsequent films primarily emphasize the character's action-oriented side.

After seeing Chapter 4 for the fist time while just vaguely remembering plot of each previous movie I watched just once at the time they came out I didn't know what to think about it. Action, cinematography, stunt work and characters were all great, but I just didn't get the movie.

So I decided watch every John Wick back to back and see Chapter 4 again. And I must say, those movies really are one story told in four chapters (so far). They continue where previous left and build on each other really nicely.

And Chapter 4 is the biggest, boldest and the most beautiful of them all. I get the movie now and I think that it's brilliant, especially the final part. There is one location that feels bit weaker than the others, but I won't be lowering the score for that.

IN A NUTSHELL: If you're a fan of the John Wick franchise like I am, you can't get enough. Time for more! This addition to the story features the uncovering of a new plan to defeat the High Table. Before John Wick can gain his freedom from this life of crime, he must face off against a new enemy with powerful alliances across the globe and forces that turn old friends into foes.

The stylish film was directed by Chad Stahelski. The writers include Shay Hatten, Michael Finch, and Derek Kolstad.

THINGS I LIKED: Who doesn't adore Keanu Reeves? He's beloved because he's a total stud and a really nice guy in real life. He wanted to do as many of the action sequences himself as possible, so he spent 12 weeks in training for martial arts and stunt driving! What a guy.

The movie brings back some franchise favorites such as Ian McShane and Laurence Fishburne, as well as some new villains and allies: Donnie Yen, Bill Skarsgard, Hiroyuki Sanada, Shamier Anderson, Lance Reddick, Clancy Brown, Natalia Tena, and Rina Sawayama.

John Wick movies are known for their incredible choreographed fight scenes. The creativity of this movie's action sequences does not disappoint. The stunt team is amazing. The John Wick franchise really has set the standard for amazing fight scenes.

A blind fighter? Wow! That made for some entertaining fight scenes. I don't think I've ever seen that before!

Ah man, that fight scene on the 222 stairs! AAAAH!

We get to travel all over the world in this movie. I always love that.

Amidst all of the killing, there is a lot of humor.

Fun fact: The Paris subway scene was filmed in a station that the city keeps available to filmmakers. It's called "Porte des Lilas." I'll be there this summer!

Fun fact 2: The movie's scene in the desert was the same place where they filmed Lawrence of Arabia!

There's a scene that features the dragon's breath shotgun, which was inspired by a 2019 video game called "Hong Kong Massacre." I absolutely love bird's-eye view, one-shot sequences. The one in this movie is crazy-good.

There's a tender moment when John Wick reveals what he wants to be written on his tombstone if and when he ever dies.

Keep watching during the rolling credits at the end for another quick scene.

Fans of the franchise will be happy to know that a TV series on the Peacock channel will soon tell the backstory of how Winston go the assassins hotel as a prequel.

THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE: One of the most unrealistic fight scenes is held among dancing Millennials and Gen Z'ers. Why is is unrealistic, you ask? Because all of the dancers would have stopped what they were doing to pull out their cell phones and video everything to upload to TikTok! Ha ha While the action sequences are ridiculously awesome, it's hard to believe that so many trained assassins missed so many close-up shots.

No spoilers: Do you believe the ending?

TIPS FOR PARENTS: This movie is not appropriate for children.

EXTREME violence Various weapons Blood Profanity, including F-bombs.

!

It took me a while to take the 2h49 to watch this movie, but let me tell you they went by in a flash. It didn't even feel like 2 hours, because this film is non-stop action, giving you no breathers inbetween. So I really pity the people who went to watch this in theatres and had to pee.

The film barely wastes 10% of its runtime on dialogue and other stuff, the rest is really never ending adrenaline. And it works. Barely any dialogue is better than more dialogue but dumb dialogue.

And this film should be final proof to everyone that the academy wouldn't know a deserving movie if it hit them in the face. This film not being nominated for (and winning with an unanimous vote) an oscar for cinematography is the most blatant display of gross incompetence on that oscars jury. I am a movie lover and within a day of watching this movie, I cannot think of a single movie EVER with more aesthetic, artistic, original and versatile cinematography. The top down tactical shooter scene alone! Biggest oscars snub I can think of. This movie was such a pleasure to watch, so many beautiful and artistic shots, the sets were designed down to the very last detail with commitment and expertise I've never seen. But yeah sure, the academy just loves their war films. Make a war film, get an oscar. Easy as that. Literally 3 out of the last 5 cinematography oscar winners are world war films. They should be ashamed.

This film would be a 10/10, if it weren't for donnie yen's character, caine. At first, when he put up the motion sensors with doorbell sound, I thought that was quite smart, but then later on he just shoots people without any of those motion sensors, so apparently he doesn't need them to overcome his blindness to locate his foes from afar accurately enough to shoot them. But then later, John wick is talking to him while ducking literally 2 yards to his left, and he seems to be unable to locate him? My god, can the writers please make up their mind as to whether the blind guy needs assistance (motion sensors) to locate enemies, or not, or is not just blind but also deaf when he's unable to locate a talking target 2 yards to his left? I mean I'm not expecting much here, just consistency with your own lore. It's not rocket science. Also didn't like the character's choreography.

Also, including lawrence fishburn's character seems pointless since he does literally nothing the entire movie.

That leads me to a 9/10 and one of the best action movies I've ever seen.

Sitting in an empty theatre watching this has fulfilled my life with happiness i never knew i could feel. John wick being mentored by the homeless after falling off a skyscraper is just some of the most badass, jaw dropping, enthralling movie moments. I cannot contain myself when i talk about this movie. John wick being hunted by everyone in new york was THE perfection of entertainment. Watching John wick get run over by a car approximately 17 times then proceeding to jump out a four story building 8 times while getting shot at 179 times, punched 42 times, and thrown by thugs 12 times to fight his blind best friend created more layers than any onion could. This movie is unironically one of my favorite movies and will watch every christmas eve with my future generations. Long live john wick.

The movie is a stunning visual masterpiece with intense action scenes and memorable characters that leave a lasting impression. John Wick's final chapter showcases his anger and frustration as he seeks freedom through an old-fashioned duel. However, before he can even consider this, he must first overcome a seemingly insurmountable army of a thousand men.

John's incredible skills shine throughout the movie, while Donnie Yen, Tracker, and Marquis make excellent enemies, each driven by their own personal motivations. Despite the movie's lengthy runtime of 2 hours and 49 minutes, I found myself completely absorbed in every scene, losing track of time entirely.

Overall, the movie is a fantastic conclusion to the series, providing the perfect blend of action, intrigue, and suspense. It was an extremely enjoyable experience, and I thank the creators for bringing such a thrilling and engaging story to life.

After the semi letdown of JW3 I was so happy that 4 made up and more. This was my favorite of the franchise. It had everything that you would expect from this movie. The fight scenes, gun scenes, choreography, music.... great soundtrack!! All were perfectly chosen. There were a few scenes where I felt the music could have been much louder. It was an odd choice and I'll crank it way up at home. They brought in some new characters ... likeable characters. I could see a spin-off with nobody. Something else with a couple others that had some loose ends that were not neatly completed.

John wick 4 really tied things together well and had a great moral to the story. It showed that our actions have consequences. Watch it on the big screen and enjoy some time with sn old friend.

As a big fan of Mr Reeves (the replacements is his acting apex in my opinion, point break best overall movie) it pains me to rate this even at 4 stars.

There is essentially zero plot.

Close quarter action sequences dilute this movie to the point of being irrelevant. There is zero plot (I know, please bear with me) evolution with this story, hashed out dialogue that would make James Corden blush, cameos that feel like they're there for no other reason than to create a TV spinoff and cinematography that would make any film school graduate turn in their future grave.

You know how you watched the fast and the furious film up until 9 and then went "naaah that's enough, I'm done"... you'll reach that point with this movie. Watch the first one and bedo e with how good it was....remind me of another Keanu franchise!!

Love it love it love it!! Awesome fights scenes and very creative and hilarious in the middle of it. And the dog wow i love him so cute but so deadly and the owner saying balls like what is That command 😂 and the twist of the end saving the last bullet very smart of him and saved his friend daughter and his life is just John Wick style the fight scenes we're so good and the drone shot of the fighting scene from above was so smart felt like i was playing a video game of John Wick im sad that yuki died tho and the super soldiers costume were cool and the high table gaurds were so cool and the paris car roundabout was also a good fight scence.

Yes I know John Wick is a tough guy but goddamn does he get put thru the ringer lol. I was honestly laughing towards the end of this movie because he gets thrown of a 15 foot balcony to the floor, beat up all to hell, hit by many vehicles, jumped out of a 3 story window and racked himself on a van, gets thrown down several flights of stairs. Amongst many other things and just keeps chugging along like nothing. Not to mention getting shot and stabbed in the last movie.

You stop and think... it's been like 3 days straight of absolute punishment for this guy lmao.

Anyway I just had to put that out there. But like c'mon... who cares right? These movies are awesome. They're made for fans of martial arts and action movies and man does it deliver! It's insane how much action is actually here.

I will say that the movie probably could've been trimmed at least a bit. It is quite long and you feel it by the end. But I get it. We're near the end of this series of movies and they wanna give it this epic conclusion.

I could go on and on about this movie honestly but I'm going to end it here lol. Definitely a kickass movie. I'll be watching it again soon for sure.

In my opinion john wick is one of the best movie in the history of international cinema because it's secens are very natural and very near to real life but in chapter4 some secens were imaginary and did't like chepter2 and1 nut totally was be great with great actors and screenplay i so enjoyed and it's my favorite movie john wick had the great ending and i very surprised the actors were great and they played very well i don't know how discribe this great movie i can't use the condign words to discribe that i just can say it was fantasic and indelible the international cinema is proud to having this great movie.

If you watched John Wick 1-3, you know what to do. If you enjoyed them, likely you will again. At least that's what I did. I turned on my John Wick mode, watching it as a computer game and not taking it slightly for real, and it was up to the expectations.

The legend continued. The plot managed to get simpler but worked out. The cinematography was impressive. Lots of beautiful scenes from Japan and Paris. The bronzed tone with cooler blue or blushed highlights gave pretty visuals, tuning down and contrasting the brutal fighting sequences (which I did have to close my eyes).

Keanu Reeves is as legendary himself. I have watched many of his movies and he does not fail. To be fair there is not too much acting, but the fighting and all are as good as it gets. I watched Donnie Yen for years, great martial art actor. Yeah he probably had some work done to his face but so what. Bravo to both actors, who are doing great fighting scenes at their age of getting close to 60.

Overall as a John Wick fan, the final chapter gave a satisfactory closure. Nicely done.

After back to back giving three successful John wick movie Chad Stahelski back again with Another bang . This time Johnathan kill more bad guy than before. 4th installment give John wick a chance to buy his freedom from high table . OMG Action sequences was Raw ,real, brutal John wick 4 set a standard for upcoming Hollywood movie.

Honestly movie is approx 3 hour long but didn't feel like to that long.

You u get a chance to watch it watch on Big screen. Big screen and intense bgm with maintain grips.

Other characters did good job . Every one love Caine and Mr. Nobody. Honestly give mr. Nobody a spinoff.

While I think they kind-of messed up with the second and third ones, this one is as good or better than the first one! The fight scenes are outstanding, and the story makes perfect sense and gets him back to the way he was in the first movie. There is great action throughout the entire movie. I would give an A+ for the fight scenes, A+ for the script, A for the acting and directing. If you liked the first one, you have to see this one. I completes the story and doesn't leave you hanging waiting for more. I was not expecting that much after 2 and 3, but this one does deliver the goods and then some!

The John Wick movies have run out of ideas and just rehash the other movies. Keanu is still stiff and half asleep throughout the movie and luckily they give him very little dialogue. The other actors are superb especially Donnie Yen, who is an actual martial artist. He's so good he makes Keanu look especially bad. Scott Atkins is great and his martial arts skill shines in this movie.

The plot is ridiculous as usual and the killing count is very high. It seems like the director enjoys the same backgrounds.....church, falling down lots of steps, dance hall where everyone keeps dancing even though there is gunfire.

It lacks the humor of the Taken movies and great acting in the Equalizer.

Loved the over-the-top action! Especially the "steps" scene. The movie was complete entertainment from start to finish. People don't watch John wick movies or the acting.. They watched them to see how many cool ways the ultimate assassin can do this thing.

Glad to see they are making a fifth installment. Awesome sauce! I'm glad Keanu enjoys making them as much as we enjoy watching them. I love Morpheus as well lol.. If you're looking for something to keep you on the edge of your seat for 3 hours... Look no further... It's hard to beat. John wick chapter 4.. anyway, that's just my two cents. Have a good one!

The first John Wick (2014) was a particularly good action that worked with a simple premise, and John Wick: Chapter 2 (2017) and John Wick Chapter 3-Parabellum (2019) were both good sequels close to being as good as the first. After watching John Wick: Chapter 4 (2023), I would say this is the best entry in the John Wick franchise.

Keanu Reeves was spectacular as John Wick; you can tell how angry he is since the ending of the last movie, and he was awesome in the fantastic action sequences. The whole cast in the movie was fantastic in action scenes each killing people in many ways, especially Donnie Yen as Caine and Tracker played by Shamier Anderson. Caine was a blind man who was cool in fight sequences, and he had a friendship with John Wick that was believable and heartwarming when they bonded, along with Tracker being cool and having a cute killer dog with him.

The action sequences were amazing to watch; they had beautiful long takes, wide shots, and occasional overhead shots. Multiple weapons are used like guns, knives, katanas, nunchucks, etc. The locations these action sequences take place in were fantastic and nicely shot with occasional pretty shots of the locations. The camera work in these action sequences was great to watch how smooth the camera moved around the actors either in fist fights, gun fights, blade fights, or action scenes with the characters driving around in cars.

Great cinematography with a lot of pretty camera shots, and a lot of action sequences that stand out with great stunt work like an action scene on long sets of stairs in Paris or in the big third act. The ending will have a lot of people talking about it for a while, but I thought it was a nice ending for the character of John Wick and thought it was also a nice ending for these John Wick movies, until they make spinoffs on certain interesting characters or a prequel.

John Wick: Chapter 4 (2023) was the best entry in the franchise and was better than the first movie John Wick (2014). Amazing action, great acting from Keanu Reeves and others, Bill Skarsgard was an exceptionally good villain, and all the characters were remarkably interesting in how they connect with John Wick. I thought this was a nice ending to the character, and I highly recommend watching this movie if you have seen the earlier three entries in this cool and fun action franchise.

This film was action packed from begging to end! All of your questions in your mind will be answered. You love John but then you find yourself saying him is it okay to like the bad opponent too? The colors were simply master blended to make Michael Angelo jealous. The stunts and kills were just heart stopping craziness! The dark sense of humor was well delivered .Sentimental parts and adding reminiscent antidotes to foreshadow Johns path was amazing!!The cars , falling down stairs, shot, everything you can imaging. John gave Michael Myers a run for his money!!!The End was a work Of A Master Mind only the Boogey Man! A Loving Husband! Watch it on the Big screen Well worth the Experience!!!!

Before entering john wick 4 you must understand the previous movies well obviously, but you gotta remember minor details like how the high table operates and some other stuff like bullet proof suits so u don't ask how don't they die right away.

John wick 4 is probably the best Action movie I've seen it's so diverse and not to mention the amazing cinematography and the action/ gun fights involved, I don't wanna spoil anything but cast choice was spot on some of the characters are just what can I say? Amazing to say the least, all villans victims and antagonists are played amazingly, each single character will play off a different vibe unlike anything you've seen before in any other movie, even newly introduced ones, filming locations as well are very well made and looks out of this world.

However nothing is perfect some plotholes are still here but they don't bother me whatsoever I can't mention all of them so I dont spoil but one of them when john fell of a high place he just got up And walked it off, baba yaga ha? Maybe he just trained his body hard lol, in this movie specifically keanus movement are very fast and he feels younger so thats a good thing, he trained after winston shot him off the building in part 3 Ofc some other plotholes like when civilians who barely react to someone who got shot or a car accident ik its not important but think about it people's reactions still is important to make a movie more realistic, tbh that's my only complaint, but why focus on these small details just enjoy the movie!

You'll be missing out if u didn't watch.

The opening scene of the forth installment of John Wick delivers an atmospheric tone providing audacity with a beat. This time round John Wick really aims to kill... Kill them all! Laurence Fishburne introduces him coming down the aisle to reach havoc on all who wrongful crossed him! The stakes will often rise with each new release John remains in exhile with very few people he can trust.

The new addition to antagonise Wick played with relentless tenacity is (Bill Skarsgard) Marquis Vincent. With big bewildering eyes alongside subtle movements Skarsgard at times has an animalistic motion, he strikes like a snake without a moments notice! Possibly the best adversary in the franchise so far with a mesmerising showcase of his abilities as an actor.

Much like what made the first movie intriguing this particular outing has character, in fact it has more character than you can shake a web at! From Caine, a charismatic blind man (Donnie Yen) showing us literally his lack of need for a cane as well as providing interesting content; well far more interesting than say Daredevil it seems. To Tracker (Shamier Anderson) a man with a extremely well trained dog; somehow no matter how absurd or ridiculous it all seems it will fit perfectly in a John Wick movie and i must say, is rather entertaining. On top of this, how can we forget Mia (Aimee Kwan) and Akira (Rina Sawayama) bringing some bad arse kicking power to accompany Wick.

This film unlike the last two manages to captures memorable moments from the game of poker to a shoot off in the desert, and capture them well as action escalates up stairs. The action scenes are some of the best around in any film whilst being shot to perfection with regards to camera angles. The birds eye view of destruction was something uniquely and visually stunning. Yes, Chad Stahelski has pushed the boat out here, with a masterclass in how to bring an action movie to life! No matter how far fetched, extreme or blatantly silly things may seem all will go way over your head with nothing except entertainment value! Okay so it might have an excessive runtime time however this is a minor thing as most films appear longer nowadays.

In The John wick films they've created this magical mysterious world, and so many wonderful characters, where the sub players themselves are fascinating enough to be the subject of their own movie. Part four hit the pinnacle in this area with about 3 different spin offs that would intrigue. I personally thought the sub character, Caine was immense and one should not ignore some fine acting and a distinguished cast.

There has been no expense spared in chapter four, from cast to settings/locations, great action sequences which are incredibly technical. This film has been extremely well made from start to end, in every department.

There will be haters, this is not meant to be an Ingmar Bergman. Love it for what it is.

Only Keannu got could play John wick.

During this film you get pretty soon the feeling "seen it all before". The amateurstic fightscènes (how an opponent is waiting to attack after his collegue gets shot is unintend hilarious), the lack of a good story nor script (I hope Mr. Reeved is paid by the amount of people he kills the same way over & over rather then by the amount of words in the script (40 if I'm not mistaken). The infantile over the top characters & acting. This franchise has it all. Unfortunately we've seen this 3 times before, the 4th time is just too much, even with Mr. Good Guy Reeves. A pure waste of time, Mr. Wick ...

Great action sequences, next level camera work. You can't take your eyes off. These things only can experienced in big screen.

Color grading is excellent. The light work between the action sequence is phenomenal.

After interval there is only actions sequences and those are GREAT. Everyone did a great job.

Runtime is little long, but your can't get bored.

It has every possible action scenes. Horse , Car, Bike , Pencil amd more.

Words can not explain the whole experience.

John wick 4 has set new bar for upcoming action movies.

Please go and experience this masterpiece by yourself. U won't go wrong.

Thank You.

John Wick: Chapter 4.

John Wick uncovers a path to defeating The High Table. But before he can earn his freedom, Wick must face off against a new enemy with powerful alliances across the globe and forces that turn old friends into foes.

The Franchise is back and this time with the largest scale of production an action movie can have, I'm very impressed and this must be a reference to all the action movies directors, when it comes to fight scenes using knives,sword or guns and way more ... Learn from the best, learn from John Wick: chapter4.

This sequel has offered an unbelievable atmosphere, the chosen locations, the cinematography and the production design, everything was very pleasing to see and you just can't get enough of it especially with the chaotic fight scenes .

A big added point to this sequel is the characters, the charismatic John of course, his friend Caine and the one with his dog... Even the villain was good presented by the talented Bill Skarsgård.

Finally, I'm not a big fan of action movies, the plot wasn't that interesting for me, just John fighting for his freedom and I guess that exactly what he was trying to do in two other previous chapters, it's not a weak point it's just can not be seen as a strong one, considering that nothing new was brought to the story .

I loved it and it's probably the best part of John Wick's journey alongside the epic first chapter when it all started .

"Man has to look his best when its time to get married, or buried."

The answer to the question in the title is: never. John Wick is the exception. This is a highly intelligent, visceral action movie with room to grow, even after this being the fourth in the series.

You know how Marvel has its universe with spin-offs for main characters? That's how I foresee the future of John Wick. I want more movies, focusing on more cities, chapters, and characters in the universe these movies have created. Cane alone would make a phenomenal addition to the series, and deserves his own film.

Keanu Reeves is better than ever in Chapter 4, but he is aging. JW fans want MORE!

1. Unleashing the Fury: "John Wick 4" takes the intensity of the previous films and multiplies it tenfold. Prepare for an adrenaline-fueled ride like no other, as Keanu Reeves once again showcases his unrivaled skills in delivering breathtaking action sequences.

2. Seamless Continuation: Continuing the saga seamlessly, "John Wick 4" picks up right where its predecessor left off, delving deeper into the enigmatic world of assassins. The film expertly expands upon the existing mythology, offering a compelling narrative that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats.

3. Stellar Cast Ensemble: Alongside Keanu Reeves, the film features a star-studded cast that includes standout performances by Laurence Fishburne and Ian McShane. The chemistry between the actors is palpable, enhancing the overall cinematic experience.

4. Visual Spectacle: From the dazzling choreography to the meticulously crafted set pieces, "John Wick 4" is a visual feast. The film's stunning cinematography, combined with its masterful use of practical effects, creates a gritty and immersive world that draws viewers into its dark depths.

5. Heart-Pounding Soundtrack: Complementing the on-screen action, the pulsating soundtrack elevates the intensity to new heights. Each beat resonates with the ferocity of the film's protagonist, creating an audiovisual symphony that amplifies the adrenaline rush.

6. Complex Character Development: "John Wick 4" delves deeper into the emotional turmoil of its titular character, exposing layers of vulnerability beneath the hardened exterior. The film explores the consequences of Wick's actions, providing a poignant exploration of loyalty, sacrifice, and redemption.

7. Unpredictable Plot Twists: Just when you think you've seen it all, "John Wick 4" throws unexpected curveballs that keep you guessing until the very end. The film skillfully blends intricate plot twists with jaw-dropping action, ensuring that the audience remains captivated throughout.

8. Unforgettable Action Sequences: The film's meticulously choreographed action sequences are nothing short of awe-inspiring. From intense gunfights to hand-to-hand combat, "John Wick 4" raises the bar, setting a new standard for action movies. Prepare for a visual spectacle that leaves you breathless.

9. World-Building Excellence: Building upon the established universe, "John Wick 4" delves deeper into the secret society of assassins, expanding its lore and introducing intriguing new elements. The film effortlessly fleshes out its fictional world, leaving audiences hungry for more.

10. A Thrilling Cinematic Triumph: "John Wick 4" is a triumph of the action genre, raising it to new heights with its impeccable craftsmanship and relentless entertainment. Keanu Reeves once again proves his status as an action icon, delivering a performance that will be remembered for years to come. This film is a must-watch for fans of the series and action enthusiasts alike.

Prepare to be blown away by "John Wick 4," a thrilling masterpiece that cements its place among the stars.

Most of the franchises after the 2nd movie maybe the 3rd movie they are bad but John Wick, men every movie is better then the previous one. What should I say for this movie? Camera shots? AMAZING. Keanu Reeves? AMAZING. Action? AMAZING. Story? AMAZING. Character development A M A Z I N G. I enjoyed this movie from the beginning until the end and I am very difficult with the movies like this but this one as the most John Wick movie ever probably the best.

Thank you Keanu you are simply amazing in action movies and as a human. I am waiting for the next to one to be even better.

Was a bit long movie but worth it. For me 10/10.

I was waiting for this movie for sometime and by god it did not disappoint on the contrary it was much more than expected. This franchise is the benchmark for any action sequences and even Marvel doesn't come close to it. Keanu Reeves as john is a perfect fit, along with addition of new characters brong more depth and life to this movie. The movie has perfect conclusion and doesn't not try to be different, it is an action film and it just does that. I loved it. Went first day first show.

In conclusion, John Wick 4 is a thrilling and unyielding continuation of the legendary franchise. It delivers everything fans have come to expect from the series and more. With its electrifying action, compelling characters, and stunning visuals, this installment firmly establishes itself as a must-watch for action enthusiasts and fans of the previous films alike. Prepare to be captivated by the sheer spectacle and intensity of John Wick's world once again.

I like to watch people getting killed. Give me a movie where people are getting killed for 3 hours and I'll be happy. Then you've come to the right place in Hollywood. Hollywood is for the mob what was once the arena in ancient Rome, but the light version. The rabble, ignorant, feasting on big screens where violence is shown as necessary, tough and sexy. John Wick is like American porn: do you like chocolate? Then we'll drown you in it. The film has a total lack of drama, a total lack of imagination and, even worse, a total lack of humour. After the umpteenth headshot I look bored at my lukewarm popcorn. Kenau Reeves, the Internet's darling of good deeds, plays a depressed killer in a black suit who does nothing but kill people. A feast to watch for the poor in spirit. Hollywood: we've got millions and what do we do? Portraying human ugliness like it is sexy.

If there's a 5, I'm certain it HAS to be a crossover with the Fast & Furious franchise. Yes, this is getting THAT live-action cartoonish.

I loved it, but there hasn't been a bad John Wick movie. In fact, after writing this review, I want to compile a best/most consistent Action franchises of all-time list. This series will HAVE to be at/near the top of the greats. Four movies in, four incredible feats.

Now, like I said above, this is getting pretty far-fetched. YES, John's survived countless ordeals, shots, hits and of course, heads-up battles with cars in the past 3 movies. Unfortunately, with this outing, they had me almost say, "enough" by the time the climax is over.

That all said, maybe I was too harsh with comparing this to the horribly over-the-top Fast & Furious films which are so fathomly unrealistic, I hated most of the movies in that series. I couldn't possibly even dislike any of the John Wicks. But...it is getting a little too hard to suspend disbelief.

So, John's in a pickle. When has he not been since his dog and car were taken from him in 2014? John must face many bosses before the climax and you can bet he'll be battling much of the almost-three-hour runtime.

The more I think about this, the more I like it. It is NOT perfect, and I would certainly rank 1 and 3 higher. Still, you need to see this if you're a fan.

As mentioned, this is nearly three hours. Mercifully, it does NOT feel that way. Well, for the most part. I examined a few scenes that dragged out longer than they should have and they were some of the non-action scenes, of course. Everything else: you're just along for the glorious ride of watching John Wick fight countless henchmen to reach his goal.

While it doesn't have the depth of 1 or the Halle Berry of 3, it's a worthy chapter in an otherwise fantastic franchise. It's also pretty good looking and has some incredible side characters with complex motives that I absolutely LOVED. In fact, the more the movie went along, the more I loved how they kept the two main side characters fresh for the three acts.

I do hope there's a John Wick: Chapter 5, but if it ends here, I'm totally fine. I mean, they kept trying to reboot TV's 24 after it's exciting and conclusive 8 initial seasons and that was a huge mistake.

John Wick's rep established in the first one holds up here. SEE THIS!!

***

Final Thoughts: Here's my ranking:

1. John Wick (2014) ~ EASY #1

2. John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum

3. John Wick: Chapter 4 ~ barely beating out the 4th spot

4. John Wick: Chapter 2.

Okay this movie is INSANE. Insane cinematography. Insane lighting. Insane sound-design. And most of all, insane action -the good ol' gun fights, hand-to-hand combats, sword-fights, everything short of tanks and fighter planes. This is everything the previous movies were, but the duration is 2x. That said, you'll still have to give it all the cinematic liberties to enjoy it thoroughly.

Keanu Reeves did exactly what you've seen him do before, nothing new, but twice as much. Special mention to Donnie Yen for the role that he was given. Rina Sawayama, Hiroyuki Sanada, Bill Skarsgård, Scott Adkins, were GOOD additions.

There may come a point where, if you're not a John Wick fan but a regular film lover, you MAY feel "Okay, dude. Stop fighting and move on to the next thing." But if you're a fan and enjoyed the previous ones, you'll have a ball with this movie.

I just enjoyed John Wick 4 and have to say that the mix of art and action in this movie is just amazing! The fight is presented like a ballet, with smooth movements and highly skilled coordination. This film is absolutely spectacular, and I fell in love with every action that was put into it. The story is simple, but managed to captivate my attention, even though the Marquis character is a bit underdeveloped. But who can deny the greatness of Keanu Reeves as John Wick? She really is stunning! Even though the story is not very strong, the action shown still manages to make up for these weaknesses. However, I feel disappointed with some of the characters who are not so alive, especially vallian, but are still disguised again with the irony that John Wick has to pay for his actions. Overall though, John Wick 4 is a must-see, especially for fans of quirky and skillful action.

Every scene was totally original, and a visual feast for the eyes. The Osaka Continental, with the gorgeous lights, and artwork that filling the background during the fast-paced fight scenes.

The close-up of the Paris DJ's lips as she spoke into the retro microphone, were taken right out of the classic Walter Hill movie The Warriors, right down to Nowhere to Run, by Martha Reeves and the Vandellas. She even called the guys, out there going to stop Wick from getting to Montmartre, "Boppers." Hill would be proud to see how his 1979 movie got memorable tributes in some of this ultra violent movie. I'm sure if he made it today, it would have over-the-top fight scenes in it as well.

The Berlin nightclub, made my jaw drop. What a cool idea mixing a crowded dance floor, streaming curtains of waterfalls, and deadly, relentless fighting in the middle, not stopping the hundreds of dancers.

The wardrobe was stunning. The Marquise was dressed to the nines, and I could wait to see what he was wearing in each scene. I was equally impressed as the Osaka Continental's Concierge disrobing into her fight ensemble. Bad guys wore interesting body armor, or designer suits.

I didn't think almost three hours was too long, or the plot too thin as some other reviewers. This movie is good enough to watch a few times.

John Wick: Chapter 4: These aren;t fights, rather ballets are being played out as John Wick (Keanu Reeves) and his friends fight off legions of attackers. Set piece battles take place in a hotel, a disco and in the traffic next to the Arc de Triomphe. The Triomphe sequence is perhaps the best as Wick has to dodge cars as well as waves of attackers sent out by the Table and attracted by the ever increasing bounty on his head. Wick is even half hanged in a Russian Orthodox Church in Berlin. Family, friendship and the comradeship forged in battle is important here, ties which have weakened must be rebuilt. Caine (Donnie Yen) is a blind assassin and old friend of Wick who is now forced to pursue him, A new bounty hunter, The Tracker (Shamier Anderson) complete with cute German shepherd (dog) is also on his trail. Most fearsome of his foes is the Marquis (Bill Skarsgård) who dispossesses Winston Scott Ian McShane and destroys his hotel. This is a dark tale, while the sheer number of deaths may appear comedic the means by which they are killed and the graphically displayed aftermath will choke the laughter in your throat. But it's not just an action thriller, there are shades of paranoic conspiracy and existential terror which infuse this film. Some pretty good acting from Reeves, Yen and the ensemble cast. DDrected by Chad Stahelski and written by Shay Hatten and Michael Finch. 8/10.

If the first part of the film was very good. The second part is so mediocre. And the third part I watch with gritted teeth. It is the fourth part that you have to spare your time, have patience and feel sorry for yourself that you are still watching. Part four does not have an interesting plot. It has no meaningful dealogues. The dealogues are like 2 weak minded people having a conversation. Just pointless. There are so many shootings and fights in the film that it's just boring to watch. You can't keep your attention on the endless gunfights and fight scenes. There are so many illogical places in the film that you start to get angry at the film. John is like some kind of superman. Maybe this is a Marvel movie? And I thought, on principle, if I watched this film not in the cinema but on home video. And I would get through all the action scenes and just watch the dialogue and the key scenes of the film and I wouldn't lose anything. And the film would last me about half an hour. And I would be completely satisfied with the quality.

The whole point of this series is no matter how hard you try no one outruns their past and his just caught up to him and he is basically trying to outrun it or get a guaranteed way out because he was brought back in twice by circumstances beyond his control and that was him realizing there is no way out except the grave and because no one could kill him hes trying to make another way out by taking down the table members as this all started by someone taking away the last gift his wife gave him and then the house where all their memories were and the truth is no matter how hard he tried someone he loves always ends up dying giving him an extra life for example in 1 Marcus died saving John and in 2 Gianna D'antonio died because of a blood marker her brother called him out on and this is all because he got sucked back in and wanted a permanent way out and in 4 he got that and his wife back.

This part of John Wick was hands down the best. I enjoyed it very much For both the plot and the choreography of the fight scenes (as always <3). That's what i love about john wick - brilliant fight scenes. Although there were of course some impossible events and again john wick survived by falling from the third floor or being hit twenty times by a car traveling at 80 km/h but it was still a very enjoyable movie. The actors did a great job especially Bill Skarsgård (Marquise) and Donnie Yen (Caine). Also inconsolable Lance Reddick and Ian McSane were fantastic as always The movie was really great, I recommend it!!!

The madness of series is increasing in every minute.

I have given 10 out of 10 stars to John Wick: Chapter 4, the latest installment in the action-packed franchise starring Keanu Reeves as the legendary assassin. Here is my spoiler-free positive review of the film.

John Wick: Chapter 4 is a thrilling ride from start to finish, with breathtaking stunts, exhilarating fights, and stunning cinematography. The film picks up where John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum left off, with John on the run from the High Table, the ruthless organization that rules the underworld. John teams up with the Bowery King (Laurence Fishburne), his old friend Caine (Donnie Yen), and a mysterious newcomer Akira (Rina Sawayama) to take down the High Table and its allies, including the Marquis (Bill Skarsgård), a sadistic High Table member who wants John dead.

The film is directed by Chad Stahelski, who has helmed all the previous John Wick films, and he delivers another masterpiece of action filmmaking. The film is full of inventive and creative set pieces, such as a car chase through Paris, a sword fight on a bullet train in Japan, and a showdown in a neon-lit nightclub in Berlin. The film also pays homage to various genres and influences, such as martial arts, westerns, spy thrillers, and comic books. The film has a distinct visual style, with vibrant colors, sleek costumes, and dynamic camera work.

The film also boasts an impressive cast of actors who bring their characters to life with charisma and skill. Keanu Reeves is phenomenal as John Wick, showing his range of emotions, physicality, and intensity. He performs most of his own stunts and fights, which adds to the realism and authenticity of the film. Donnie Yen is a great addition to the franchise, as he showcases his martial arts prowess and chemistry with Reeves. Rina Sawayama is a revelation as Akira, a mysterious and badass female character who has her own agenda. Bill Skarsgård is terrifying as the Marquis, a twisted and ruthless villain who enjoys torturing his enemies. The film also features returning favorites such as Ian McShane as Winston, Lance Reddick as Charon, and Hiroyuki Sanada as Shimazu.

John Wick: Chapter 4 is a must-watch for fans of action films and the John Wick franchise. It is a satisfying conclusion to John's story arc, while also leaving room for more adventures in the future. It is one of the best films of 2023 and deserves all the praise and accolades it has received.

The first 3 movies were setting the lore with new elements. First movie, you learn about John Wick. Second movie, you discover the Continental and all it's implication. Third movie, you learn about the high table, their hierarchy, John's origin etc.

The 4th movie feels empty in term of new ideas. Basically, they just bring another high-graded goon sent by the table, just like the judicator in chapter 3.

They also bring back the concept of the assassin that uses dog to fight.

Finally, the whole part were John seeks asylum in his family and got his ticket cancelled is all reversed already.

Otherwise, the movie is great. Intense action, touching tribute to Lance Reddick and the ftop-view fight scene are really well done.

John Wick 4 gives it all with its never-before-seen action stunts that will take your breathe... literally. There are some stunts that are fresh from the oven, it's the first time it's been done in the history of filmmaking. The pacing is frenetic and the action sequences are jaw-droppingly awesome, you'll never get enough of them.


A special shoutout to the cinematography team. Every time Mr Wick is punching, kicking, smashing and every other verb you can think of, the cameras have their ways of putting us on a ride; like a curious kid standing close only feet apart watching everything happening before his eyes. It is breathtaking, it is vibrant and it really feels like we're there with John Wick.








However, because there isn't many long-running characters left, it may be a drag for some audience. John Wick 4 isn't the same like the other 3, it is heavier, bloodier, and its neo-noir looks are refined and richer, it'll make you feel you're watching Blade Runner 2049 instead. Some will appreciate its tonal shift but others won't accept the new look, feel and heavy-themed stories.





Verdict: Defining the action genre, John Wick Chapter 4 offers an orgy of violence, nail-biting kinetic action sequences that will set the bar for the rest of the one man army movies in decades to come. It may not be THE best John Wick film but WOW, this is first class entertainment at its finest.

A pleasant surprise: I didn't expect the fourth installment to be so good ! Definitely the first one is the best , but this one is an absolutely worthy continuation!!! Well done !!!

With all due respect to the people who liked this movie, the first one was a good movie, lsa 2 and 3 passable, but this one has been insufferable, long, tedious, boring, when you see a movie and you're looking forward to it ending , to find out what ghostly ending they invent, shows that it is not a good movie.

When I go to see an action movie, I look for an action movie, "bourne", "revenge", etc, if I want to go see a science fiction one, I like that there are spaceships, and if I want to see a superhero one, That's what I want to see, this movie is so unrealistic that it doesn't connect with the viewer at any time, at least not with me.

Whoever liked it, I'm glad you like this type of cinema, but I don't like "Fast & Furious" style ghosts, so in my opinion, it's not that I left the cinema disappointed, I left pissed off for having lost almost three hours.

Few times in lives have I experienced the action genre evolve and setting a new standard for how action films should be made. Not much about the world of John Wick makes sense, unless you accept this alternative reality where assassin's roam the streets and run the world from the shadows, but it doesn't matter when you watch this film because you're watching art. This film is easily the best in the series due to it's perfected choreography. At times I would drop my jaw and start wondering how any of these scenes where possible until next scene would come and amaze me yet again. I was a bit disappointed at end of the film, but then again all good thing a come to an end. I refuse to believe John Wick is gone.

By now anyone watching a John Wick movie must know what to expect. And boy does this movie deliver. The action sequences are a joy to watch mostly because the shots are long, minimum cuts, and fabulous choreography overall. It was shockingly amazing to see Keanu drifting the car himself while picking up his gun from the road, and many more consecutive car stunts in single shots were very refreshing to see. The story was linear but still reasonably engaging.

Just like the first movie, this movie also has a dog as plot point. I can't say more about it without giving out spoilers. To sum up, I would like to say that this movie can be set as the benchmark for modern action movies. Unlike those Liam Neeson flicks where nobody knows for sure what's going on due to hose excessive cuts in editing, this movie delivered pure satisfaction in its action scenes. Isn't it what everyone seeks in an action movie?

Definitely one of the most well choreographed and creative action movies in recent cinema, Chad Stahelski and Keanu Reeves have certainly reached new heights with John Wick 4's masterfully crafted stunts and set pieces. Sure the gun fights aren't exactly realistic but the film doesn't exactly try to be, and although a lot of the stuntmen accommodate for a slower, aging Keanu this doesn't take away from the thrill of the action sequences by any means.

The nay sayers may complain about the lack of story, but I think the film still does a good enough job with explaining the idea of the high table and Wick's seemingly impossible battle with them - which is all wrapped up pretty nicely and paced out actually quite well in the near 3 hour runtime.

So JW4 pretty much continues from where JW3 left off. The Continental Hotel is destroyed by the High Table and our new baddie, The Marquis, rears his head!

No spoilers here - just more great gun-fu which if you love the John Wick movies should make you very happy! Plenty of set piece gun & sword play once again. Yes the violence is completely over the top but that's the whole point of these movies right?

From New York to Osaka and over to Paris for the grand finale. This genre is made for Keanu to strut his stuff and it's great fun as always. Winston is back and plays a more integral part in this plot. Cain is a great addition to the characters as is "Nobody" and his pet dog. Again, no spoilers here so you'll just have to see for yourself!

The fight choreography is fantastic as always and there is plenty of it. Beautiful backdrops abound and JW4 fits in very nicely with the three previous films. 🤗

Can't wait for JW5?!?!

Seeing as Stahelski was a stuntman during the Matrix trilogy, it makes sense that John Wick movies are back-to-back stunts turned up to 11.

Reeves himself was a rough and tumble ice hockey player back in the day in Canaydia. Those roots show throughout.

The images are decadent with colour but not subtle. The story and dialogue is workmanlike and efficient.

The action peaks in an epic sequence that is part Taxi Driver's overhead shot after the massacre, part hi-res FPS video game 3rd person replay, and it touches on genius.

Each of these movies has expanded the "Wick world" so to speak, and in doing so Wick hasn't had an opportunity to reflect. It's been run and gun since day one, son.

Should there be another chapter, and I suspect there will be, here's hoping they slowly strip back the layers of decadence and allow us a moment of peace and happiness.

But let us earn that tranquility with one final run. What say you, Mr Wick?

Well... how to begin?

While the movie is super well made with plenty of fights and special effects... what I'm looking for in a movie (generally) is the suspension of disbelief, but you can forget about that for this movie... some scenes are so ludicrous and ridiculous they made me chuckle and I lost focus more than once.

I'm not sure if it was intended... but it felt more like a comedic action movie than an action movie like the 3 previous movies were. Some scene were cut and pieces of previous scene with a different angle or something... the movie felt like a parody of itself half way through... maybe it was intented that way? I was confused to say the least.

That being said I was greatly entertained, thus the 8 stars.

I really liked this film. For the first 90 minutes or so. Then, as the body count exceeded what I thought to be roughly 15 thousand souls, I started to feel like I was missing out on life. The feeling grew exponentially, with every batch of 5 thousand casualties.

When John Wick began his ascent to the top of Sacré Coeur, where he faced a hundred new villains (probably the planet's last surviving human male specimens), I considered leaving. But it was Mr. Nobody yelling his "balls" cormmand (whereupon his dog jumps at a man's crotch, and then urinates over his dead body) that achieved the feat.

On my way home, I reminisced about the good old days, when an action-loaded, far-fetched but highly entertaining movie could be squeezed into 87 minutes (e.g. Commando, 1985; btw. 51% of the running time of John Wick: Chapter 4).

Anyway, ChatGPT informs me that "There is no clear evidence to suggest that watching stupid films or any other form of entertainment can significantly lower a person's IQ," so it's not all bad. But I lost good lunch money and 3 hours of my life, and there's no refund on these.

This is easily the best John Wick out of all of them and one of the best action movies of the decade so far. When I saw this movie, the theater was packed and it deserved to be. The John Wick franchise and Keanu Reeves literally bring people together and action like this is what we need in our movies, real stunts on camera with real effort and without needless CGI! Donnie Yen killed it in his role and there are fantastic sequences that blew me away (the stairs scene, the Paris traffic scene around the Arc De Triomphe, and the ending duel specifically). The wet night club fight and the fancy Japanese hotel scene were astounding as well, and throw in the humor and the dog as the two cherries on top. Take notes Hollywood! And huge shoutout to Keanu Reeves for doing stunts and work like this at his age still, he's just as impressive as Tom Cruise!

The movie picks up after the events of Chapter 3. John is still on the run, and the bounty on his head keeps growing. He has to face off against some of the most dangerous killers in the world, while also trying to bring down the powerful organization known as The High Table. As with previous films, Chapter 4 doesn't spend much time explaining things, but that's not a big problem because you're really here for the action.

And the action in this movie is absolutely incredible. Each fight scene is carefully choreographed, making every punch, kick, and gunshot feel intense and real. The filmmakers did a great job of keeping the action fresh by introducing new types of weapons and environments for the battles. For example, one scene takes place in a massive club with water pouring from the ceiling while John fights off attackers, which is both unique and visually impressive.

The stunts are also amazing. From car chases through busy streets to sword fights in dark alleyways, John Wick: Chapter 4 is packed with moments that will make you gasp. Keanu Reeves does many of his own stunts, which makes the action feel even more authentic. The movie uses long, unbroken shots during fight scenes, so you can see everything clearly without quick cuts or shaky cameras. This helps you really appreciate the skill and effort put into each battle.

Aside from the action, the film also explores new parts of the John Wick universe. We get to see more about the rules of The High Table and meet interesting new characters, like Caine, a blind assassin who becomes one of John's toughest opponents. This adds a bit more depth to the story, even though the plot isn't the main focus.

One thing that could have been improved is the length of the movie. At almost three hours, it starts to feel a little too long. Some scenes could have been shorter without losing any of the excitement. Still, the non-stop action makes it worth the watch.

Overall, John Wick: Chapter 4 delivers exactly what you want from the series: spectacular action, thrilling stunts, and Keanu Reeves at his best. If you love action movies, this one's a must-see. This film deserves a 8.5 rating but I cant do that on here;/

John Wick and all of the franchise colorful characters are back...with a few newbies. This film starts right where the last one ends, The High Table sends the Marquis to punish Winston at the New York branch for helping John Wick...this results in The Consierge Charon being killed and the hotel being blown up. The only way back is to team up with John Wick again. In his quest to get out, Wick has to challenge the Marquis through the High Table setting up an eventual Old West style dual.

Before the dual can happen...Wick has to get a voice to challenge the High Table through his Russian family, requiring a seemingly impossible job, and of course he has to get to the dual site.

This brings back the radio oddsmaker ladies, whose on-air spokes-personality is always teasingly tantalizing!

The sheer number of stunts in this film make this a must see. In the quest to get to the location of the dual...Wick must fight a literal up hill battle.

If the number of stunts isn't enough to convince you to see this film, there is also the amazing international backdrop which is stunning by itself. Modern, sleek and visually appealing there is a lot of eye candy to enjoy. One teaser, there is a new character called The Tracker who brings a new dog to the John Wick story.

I have really enjoyed watching the John Wick series of films. Enjoyed.

The point of these films is not anything than being stylised actioner.

I have not been blown away by the dialogue. Although, it does put a smile on your face when Keanununu delivers a "Yeah".

I have not been blown away by the plot. It's silly.

Very silly.

BUT what I have been enamoured by is the enjoyment level. Some incredible fighting sequences have been choreographed in this series of films.

Chapter 4 attempts to keep to that level. I can't remember a horse fu moment in this one and the close quarter gun fighting in rooms full of glass has been done before in previous films. It's fun but nothing original pops out. Oh, the overhead room to room combat. Oooh that's very good. Oh and Caine.

This is like a grand tour of the house of John Wick.

Lots of guns. Lots of bodies. Lots of fighting. Cool clothes. All within an intricately designed universe of the high table and beyond.

I presume you have watched the other 3 John Wicks. If not please start from the beginning or this will look way OTT (than it already is).

It's a fun, entertaining action film. Not the best in the series but it does uphold the high standards for the action genre.

As action films go, I have enjoyed this and more so in the context of the other 3 films.

Switch off and let the silliness and the fun of it all sweep over you.

The movie is worth the wait. This movie franchise has set the bar really high for action movies and it is going to be a benchmark of sorts for the action movies of future. Keanu Reeves is amazing, as he has been in the first 3 installments. Donnie Yen is treat to watch and his action sequences are just mind blowing. The run time is a bit on the higher side but you will not feel that. The action seems a bit over the top at certain times but it does not last long. This movie franchise is making audience fall in love with close combat action and its good. Watch it in a good theater with proper sound and screen. The experience will be enhanced.

John Wick: Chapter 4 continues with the story of John Wick(Keanu Reeves), after the events of John Wick(2014), John Wick: Chapter 2(2017) & John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum(2019). John discovers a way to defeat The High Table. However, to walk away from his old life, he has to square off against a sinister new enemy, with strong alliances worldwide & forces that turn former allies into enemies.

John Wick: Chapter 4 is an awe-inspiring film. Director Chad Stahelski can do no wrong with the John Wick franchise & has knocked it out of the park, yet again. The action set pieces are mind-blowing & the best of the franchise, so far. Hats off to the stunt team for intricately crafting each action sequence. Keanu Reeves is spectacular as John Wick. Laurence Fishburne is superb as Bowery King. Donnie Yen is outstanding as Caine. Bill Skarsgard is fantastic as Marquis. Ian McShane is great as Winston. Hiroyuki Sanada is brilliant as Shimazu. The supporting cast is excellent. John Wick: Chapter 4 is a must watch for fans of the John Wick franchise. My ranking of the John Wick movies are John Wick(2014), John Wick: Chapter 4(2023), John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum(2019) & John Wick: Chapter 2(2017).

Although I watched all 3 previous of this franchise, I was mostly bored to death by the continuous jiu jitsu fighting, but the great casting and production design always appealed my senses.

The 4th one wouldn't lack in these strengths, but the Indian-movie-like duration was scaring the heck out of me. A few minutes in and I had forgotten my fears. Great scenery, super casting and thrilling action were in the rendez-vous. Donnie Yen, Hiroyuki Sanada, Marko Zaror and the unreckognisable -until after the movie- Skott Adkins made my night.

What a great feeling to see my favorite actors, and particularly Keanu and Donnie fight together or against each other. Skott Adkins gave an amazing performance not only in fighting but also in acting this time.

This last movie I got from RARBG lost brothers was a treat. The feared duration is no problem if I want to watch it again, already watched the last 30-40min more than once. So I decided and already collected the whole franchise.

Despite an ending that similarly to Daniel Craig's James Bond closes nicely the franchise, there seem now to exist so many possibilities for broadening the francise to any possible extent.

All of the crooks that appeared in the film were real-life criminals and mafia members who were paid astronomical sums of money to appear in it. Bringing in the best of these guys isn't the easy part, KUDOS to the entire team.

Director Chad Stahelski did put every effort to bring in the best of Keanu and the case, Wick is Wicked and absolute fruckingly made action movie.

Stands out with the top list of action movies ever made, should be proud for the time the production team took and what they have delivered.

NO other best way to give farewell to Lance Reddick.

Best screenplay and it's the original content, waiting for the 4 hour long cut on the screens.

Chad is an amazing director he absolutely nailed the cinematography to emote many styles/ genres or mind blowing homages to old movies classics and a couple of parodies of the matrix series, for example a perfect anime style shot of john wick stood next to a cherry blossom tree in red light, with an equally perfect backdrop of a dark building with sharp lines from red lighting and omg JUST LOOK AT IT vibe IT'S SO WELL DONE you might have to rewind and pause this scene to check it's not animated.

In no particular order, fights are beautifully choreographed, some cyber punk ish neon rooms with a subtle daft punk vibe, a matrix call back where john fights through rain and water including big punches and punch volleys.

Utterly glorious stunt work, set pieces, keanu with nunchucks YES IT IS ACTUALLY KEANU and an equally exsquisite room clearing scene but this time it's an over head view akin to a dungeon crawler game, where keanu just annahilites bad guys with dragon breath rounds, frantic scrambling, around for cover and close quarters combat.

You might feel breathless just watching it !

Yes i could probably gush more like many other reviewers BUT now i must nit pick a few things that just didn't work or feels out of place.

The elephant in the room being lance riddicks untimely tragic passing and this follows charons tragic, imho pointless, empty death.

Kain : interesting character but a little heavy on the plot armor, what with being blind and all.

The marqius army : The marquis henchmen are like a call back to the agents / twins of the matrix, minus the sunglasses, like a who's who of type cast mercs from other action movies, and then they go even further with a 'smith' like right hand guy but man he also gets some crazy plot armor.

Scott adkins in a fat suit trying to be the matrix marovingian: The poor accent, the gold teeth, the strange mix of running away bleeding, then suddenly stops to fight, kick johns ass, then get stabbed again, runs, fights again, then just falls to his death. He certainly embraced the cringe, kind of impressive he could still do his martial arts in the suit, but oof .

The marquis: skarsgard did a great job as the big bad, the scrapping of the spoon in the tea cup, the slick heavy accent, smooth yet menacing.

Yes john wick himself is also hysterically covered in plot armor but he is the star of the movie so it's a given.

I think the wardrobe dept needs a shout out, for the AMAZING suits, like seriously those can't have been cheap to make ! Perfectly tailored to the actors even the tall beefy henchmen !

On the whole great movie but imho jw 3 is better.
